00078   class TRR : public Trajectory {
00079     static const int magic;       // various internal constants
00080                                   // GROMACS uses...
00081     static const int DIM;
00082 
00083     // This is the internal header for a TRR frame
00084     struct Header {
00085       bool bDouble;
00086       int ir_size;
00087       int e_size;
00088       int box_size;
00089       int vir_size;
00090       int pres_size;
00091       int top_size;
00092       int sym_size;
00093       int x_size;
00094       int v_size;
00095       int f_size;
00096 
00097       int natoms;
00098       int step;
00099       int nre;
00100       float tf;
00101       float lambdaf;
00102       double td;
00103       double lambdad;
00104     };
00105 
00106   public:
00107     explicit TRR(const std::string& s) : Trajectory(s), xdr_file(ifs()) {
00108       init();
00109     }
00110 
00111     explicit TRR(const char* p) : Trajectory(p), xdr_file(ifs()) {
00112       init();
00113     }
00114     explicit TRR(std::iostream& is) : Trajectory(is), xdr_file(ifs()) {
00115       init();
00116     }
00117 
00118     uint natoms(void) const { return(hdr_.natoms); }
00119 
00123     float timestep(void) const { return(0); }
00124 
00125     uint nframes(void) const { return(frame_indices.size()); }
00126     bool hasPeriodicBox(void) const { return(hdr_.box_size != 0); }
00127     GCoord periodicBox(void) const { return(box); }
00128     
00129     void updateGroupCoords(AtomicGroup& g);
00130     
00131     std::vector<GCoord> coords(void) { return(coords_); }
00132 
00133     // TRR specific attributes...
00134     std::vector<double> virial(void) const { return(vir_); }
00135     std::vector<double> pressure(void) const { return(pres_); }
00136     std::vector<GCoord> velocities(void) const { return(velo_); }
00137     std::vector<GCoord> forces(void) const { return(forc_); }
00138 
00139     bool isDouble(void) const { return(hdr_.bDouble); }
00140     bool hasVirial(void) const { return(hdr_.vir_size != 0); }
00141     bool hasPressure(void) const { return(hdr_.pres_size != 0); }
00142     bool hasCoords(void) const { return(hdr_.x_size != 0); }
00143     bool hasVelocities(void) const { return(hdr_.v_size != 0); }
00144     bool hasForces(void) const { return(hdr_.f_size != 0); }
00145 
00146     double time(void) const { return( hdr_.bDouble ? hdr_.td : hdr_.tf ); }
00147     double lambda(void) const { return( hdr_.bDouble ? hdr_.lambdad : hdr_.lambdaf); }
00148 
00149     int step(void) const { return(hdr_.step); }
00150

00152   private:
00153     void init(void);
00154     int floatSize(Header& h);
00155     bool readHeader(Header& h);
00156 
00157     // These simplify reading of blocks of data from the TRR file.
00158     // Templatized since GROMACS can store data in either single or
00159     // double-precision...
00160 
00161     template<typename T>
00162     void readBlock(std::vector<double>& v, const uint n, const std::string& msg) {
00163       T buf[n];
00164       uint i = xdr_file.read(buf, n);
00165       if (i != n)
00166         throw(std::runtime_error("Unable to read TRR " + msg));
00167       for (i=0; i<n; ++i)
00168         v.push_back(buf[i]);
00169     }
00170 
00171 
00172     // This assumes the block of data are triplets and converts them
00173     // into GCoords, scaling from nm to Angstroms along the way...
00174     template<typename T>
00175     void readBlock(std::vector<GCoord>& v, const uint n, const std::string& msg) {
00176       T* buf = new T[n];
00177       if (buf == 0)
00178         throw(std::runtime_error("Out of memory"));
00179 
00180       if (xdr_file.read(buf, n) != n) {
00181         delete[] buf;
00182         throw(std::runtime_error("Unable to read TRR " + msg));
00183       }
00184       for (uint i=0; i<n; i += DIM)
00185         v.push_back(GCoord(buf[i], buf[i+1], buf[i+2]) * 10.0);
00186 
00187       delete[] buf;
00188     }
00189 
00190 
00191     // Note: Assumes that the object Header has already been read...
00192     template<typename T>
00193     bool readRawFrame() {
00194       
00195       // Should it be an error/warning if the frame has different
00196       // number of atoms from what was previously read?
00197       natoms_ = hdr_.natoms;
00198 
00199       // Clear data first...
00200       box_.clear();
00201       vir_.clear();
00202       pres_.clear();
00203       velo_.clear();
00204       forc_.clear();
00205       coords_.clear();
00206 
00207       if (hdr_.box_size) {
00208         readBlock<T>(box_, DIM*DIM, "box");
00209         box = GCoord(box_[0], box_[4], box_[8]) * 10.0;   // Convert
00210                                                           // to angstroms
00211       }
00212 
00213       if (hdr_.vir_size)
00214         readBlock<T>(vir_, DIM*DIM, "virial");
00215       if (hdr_.pres_size)
00216         readBlock<T>(pres_, DIM*DIM, "pressure");
00217       
00218       if (hdr_.x_size)
00219         readBlock<T>(coords_, hdr_.natoms * DIM, "Coordinates");
00220 
00221       if (hdr_.v_size)
00222         readBlock<T>(velo_, hdr_.natoms * DIM, "Velocities");
00223       
00224       if (hdr_.f_size)
00225         readBlock<T>(forc_, hdr_.natoms * DIM, "Forces");
00226 
00227       
00228       return(! ((xdr_file.get())->fail() || (xdr_file.get())->eof()) );
00229     }
00230 
00231     void rewindImpl(void) { ifs()->clear(); ifs()->seekg(0, std::ios_base::beg); }
00232     void seekNextFrameImpl(void) { }
00233     void seekFrameImpl(uint);
00234 
00235 
00236     bool parseFrame(void) {
00237       if (!readHeader(hdr_))  // Catch EOF
00238         return(false);
00239 
00240       if (hdr_.bDouble)
00241         return(readRawFrame<double>());
00242 
00243       return(readRawFrame<float>());
00244     }
00245 
00246 
00247   private:
00248     internal::XDR xdr_file;
00249     std::vector<GCoord> coords_;
00250     GCoord box;
00251     uint natoms_;
00252     std::vector<size_t> frame_indices;   // Index into file for start
00253                                          // of frame header
00254 
00255     std::vector<double> box_;
00256     std::vector<double> vir_;
00257     std::vector<double> pres_;
00258     std::vector<GCoord> velo_;
00259     std::vector<GCoord> forc_;
00260 
00261     Header hdr_;
00262   };

00266 };
